intro: Lappula wendelboi, commonly known as the Wendelbo's lappula, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Eurasia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Lappula wendelboi thrives in nutrient-poor, rocky soils and is adapted to cold climates with short growing seasons.
